title: Will the UN Security Council adopt a resolution concerning Somalia between 29 November 2017 and 22 December 2017 ?
preds: Most of the security council is engaged in other matters. Somalia is not a priority.
Recent action on Somalia make it unlikely that the Security Council will take action on Somalia before December 22.

The UN Security Council adopted Resolution 2385 regarding Somalia on November 14th, 2017 - outside the parameters.  There are no pending reports to the Council from any committees on the Council schedule thru Dec. 22, 2017.  Nothing on the Security Council schedule regarding Somalia during this timeframe.    Barring a horrific - out of the ordinary, not typical - attack, I don't predict a special session of the UN Security Council to adopt any resolutions regarding Somalia. The area is volatile enough to warrant  the most minimal chance that unrest/attack would warrant attention and resolution by the UN Security Council in proposed timeframe.

The consensus here seems to be very low. However, all is not stable in Somalia. http://mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUSKBN1E81XF  As this week progresses the probability diminishes unless there are other warning signs.
Per resolution passed in November. Thanks dsarin!

Looked at Meeting schedule. Do not see anything on it for December but still wondering if Mandate Schedule means reauthorization. Stopping ships at sea may be covered in arms embargo. Cautiously lowering. http://www.un.org/en/sc/inc/pages/pdf/pow/powmonthly.pdf

Best info I could find on mandate schedule, reauthorization, is here. http://www.un.org/en/sc/inc/pages/pdf/sccycles.pdf   Raising due to authorization to stop ships at sea needs reauthorization about now.

Thanks for asking question. Learning more about UN. There is a mandate and reporting schedule. Short a crisis this is a good place to look for what is happening at SC and pending resolutions. I will examine that and updat shortly. I do 2 things...ask myself what do I need to know to answer the question and where can I get that information. Thanks again.

Nov 14 was the IN SC Resolution 2385. Extends arms embargo. Embargo of charcoal too as Al-Shabab is making money from this. Likely no further action unless new events occur. They are also studying whether Al-Shabab has hooks into Chemical Industry. A resolution might result from that but unlikely in this time frame.

Initially, just going with the crowd, as I have no pre-existing background info which would affect my opinion. But a few things I'd be interested in answering, which might help: * What’s a “resolution”? What does one even look like?
* What’s the process for “adopting a resolution”?
* How often are “resolutions” “adopted”? And/or, how difficult?
* How often does the UNSC meet? How are meetings scheduled?
    - And what does it take to call an emergency meeting? I assume current issues (based on info found, below) isn't likely to mean an emergency meeting.
* Are upcoming UNSC agenda published anywhere?
* What events led to this Q being asked in HFC?
* Who might be perusing a resolution wrt Somalia? ------ From the S.C. Resolutions page linked in the question: * Resolutions primarily look like meeting minutes, mostly recognizing different aspects (+, -, or neutral) of hot topics.
* Short term trend: Two recent resolutions (Nov 7 & 14), concerning Somalia. By itself, would seem highly likely to have more.
* Important: From the 7th, mostly about piracy near Somalia. So keeping an eye out for news on piracy in the region. No call for followup on any specific dates, except “within 9 months,” “within 11 months.”
* ANOTHER Q: Is Somalian piracy seasonal? If so, does it usually get worse in Nov., such that we may expect more activity from the UNSC, to address it? It's an equatorial country, though.
* From the 14th, mostly about Somalian government and sovereignty: Al-Shabaab, ISIS; corrruption in government/talk of targeted sanctions on corrupt actors, and/or bans on certain materiel. “Somalia and Eritrea Monitoring Group” mandate extends to December 15. ------ [Provisional Programme of Work of the SC - Dec 2017](https://www.un.org/en/sc/inc/pages/pdf/pow/powmonthly.pdf) Found this. Nothing about Somalia on the docket, from what I see. Just not a big enough issue to mention on the calendar? However, November's meetings made its calendar, so nothing seems scheduled (yet). ------ [Tentative Forecast of the Programme of Work of the SC for the Month of Dec 2017](https://www.un.org/en/sc/inc/pages/pdf/pow/forecast.pdf) Two reports (at least) on Somalia are due during December. Is there a kind of S.C. "general session" in which they'd be heard, but there may not be enough work to call a special S.C. meeting about Somalia, specifically, which might cause a "resolution" on Somalia to be adopted?

UN Security Council to monitor development in months after Nov. embargo extension:
http://www.africanews.com/2017/11/15/un-security-council-renews-arms-sanctions-on-eritrea-and-somalia//
Low because they adopted sanctions on Nov 14th in resolution 2385.
Qatar and Somalia just reached a deal on a 2bn usd loan, to fix some humanitarian problems.
